content: What are the counterparts of Sum.inl and Sum.inr of a general Sigma type?
Those are constructors of Sum. The constructor of Sigma is Sigma.mk (there's just a single constructor)

Maybe you're asking this because you are wondering how sigma types are sums?

The connection is that Sum can be thought of as being a sigma type where Î± is a two-term type (like Bool). Sum.inl corresponds to when the first component of Sigma.mk is false, and Sum.inr corresponds to when the first component is true.

Got it. Thanks!
I'm looking into the Sigma type precisely because I don't want to repeat the same proof twice for both legs of a Sum type.
